cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with error correcting codes and their properties, which are typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and coding theory (cs.CC) sub-categories. The paper also introduces a new type of code, called robust batch codes, which involves multiple queries to the codeword and can be seen as a generalization of the MDS property. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the distributed systems (cs.DS) and distributed computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the security implications of its results, which could place it in the cryptography (cs.CR) sub-category.
